org.docheinstein.mp3doctor.playlist

Class Playlist

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.docheinstein.mp3doctor.commons.adt.ObservableListManager<Song>
      • org.docheinstein.mp3doctor.playlist.Playlist
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.beans.Observable, FileWrapper, ListListener<Song>, ObservableListListener<Song>

    public class Playlist
extends ObservableListManager<Song>
implements javafx.beans.Observable, FileWrapper
    Represents a playlist, which essentially is a list of song with a name.

    This class implements the Observable interface which makes it easy to be listened for changes and the FileWrapper interface since a playlist is mapped to a custom file on the disk.

      • onElementsAdded

        public void onElementsAdded(java.util.List<? extends Song> songs)
        Description copied from interface: ListListener
        Called when elements are added to the list.

        If multiple items are added at the same time (e.g. with List.addAll(int, Collection) this method is called just once for all the elements.

        Specified by:
        onElementsAdded in interface ListListener<Song>
        Overrides:
        onElementsAdded in class ObservableListManager<Song>
        Parameters:
        songs - the added elements

      • onElementsRemoved

        public void onElementsRemoved(java.util.List<? extends Song> songs)
        Description copied from interface: ListListener
        Called when elements are removed from the list.

        If multiple items are removed at the same time (e.g. with List.removeAll(Collection) this method is called just once for all the elements.

        Parameters:
        songs - the removed elements

      • onElementsChanged

        public void onElementsChanged(java.util.List<? extends Song> songs)
        Description copied from interface: ObservableListListener
        Called when elements are updated in the list.

        The changes to the list's elements are detected via the Observable interface which is implemented by the elements.

        If multiple items are updated at the same time (e.g. with List.replaceAll(UnaryOperator) this method is called just once for all the elements.

        Specified by:
        onElementsChanged in interface ObservableListListener<Song>
        Overrides:
        onElementsChanged in class ObservableListManager<Song>
        Parameters:
        songs - the changed elements

      • loadPlaylistFromCache

        private void loadPlaylistFromCache()
        Loads the playlist's songs from the cache by parsing the underlying file and adding a song for each entry.

        Pay attention: the songs must exist in the current songs library.

      • savePlaylistToCache

        private void savePlaylistToCache()
        Saves the playlist's song to the cache, writing an entry for each song.
